Major research and development duties include assistance with reagent formulation and optimization of existing formulations. Additional duties involving organizing and facilitating timely progress and completion of projects will be assigned. Key Accountabilities + Assists in the activities associated with the development of new or improved autoimmune diagnostic products in accordance with established procedures. + Assists in transfer of autoimmune diagnostic products to the Manufacturing group in accordance with established procedures. + Assists with the preparation of pilot product reagents according to Manufacturing Documents. + Assists with the evaluation of raw materials, in-process materials and finished reagents associated with pilot products. + Performs laboratory bench work including sample dilutions, running of assays, experiment preparation, and disposal of used reagents. + Properly maintains detailed Design Control Records, laboratory notebooks, scientific reports, and any associated documentation for all research and development activities in accordance with Quality Systems Regulations (QSRs). + Assists with processing and analyzing data, using software tools such as Excel and Analyse-it. + Assists with organizing data, reports, and other documentation to facilitate smooth progress of development activities. + Sets-up, operates and cleans equipment used in the development and preparation of autoimmune products according to Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) + Informs supervisor of laboratory equipment needs and other supplies required to avoid interruptions in research schedules.
